questions.question_text:
An architect is tasked with designing a new vSphere environment for a customer. The new environment must:
Be standardized, repeatable, and consistent
Contain the same common heterogenous components that run from commercial hardware across an on-premises, edge, and broad hybrid cloud eco-system
Provide intrinsic and intelligent security in every component from the hypervisor to the storage, networking, and management layers
Which VMware solution will satisfy these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C, existing storage does not support VADP

Selected Answer: C
. A and B don`t sound logical because of this requirement:
 "tasked the architect with updating data protection operations" if the array does not support VADP it will have to use agent based processing. Single datacenter so no need for stretched cluster. Should be C

Selected Answer: C
I think the correct answer is C.

Selected Answer: A
Sounds like they have everything they need to stay on Fiber so A seems to be a good choice.

choices.B: The architecture will replace the Fibre Channel storage array with an updated model, scaling out storage capacity as required.
choices.A: The architecture will extend the Fibre Channel external storage array, scaling out storage and compute by buying additional storage or server capacity as required.
choices.C: The architecture will be based on vSAN Ready Nodes, scaling out storage and compute by buying additional hyper-converged servers as required.
choices.D: The architecture will be based on stretched vSAN Ready Nodes, scaling out storage and compute by buying additional hyper-converged servers as required.

questions.question_text:
An architect is designing an upgrade to an existing vSphere environment. The project has been created to provide options for enabling growth and scalability, without increasing the data center footprint. The CIO has also tasked the architect with updating data protection operations, from the current agent-based backup approach.
During a workshop with key stakeholders, the following information has been noted:
The existing vSphere environment uses an external fibre attached storage array for the vSphere environment
The storage array is connected via 4 Gbps fibre cards host bus adaptors (HBAs)
The storage array does not support VMware Storage APIs—Data Protection (VADP)
The architecture must support scaling virtual machines CPU, memory, and storage
The environment will grow by an additional 20% virtual machines year over year
Only two additional racks of equipment can be provisioned
Which design choice will meet these requirements?

choices.D: The solution will deploy a VMware vCenter instance in the primary site management domain for the virtual infrastructure management of production compute workloads.
choices.E: The solution will deploy a VMware vCenter instance in the primary site management domain for virtual infrastructure management of production and development compute workloads.
choices.A: The solution will deploy a VMware vCenter instance in each management domain for the virtual infrastructure management of management workloads.
choices.F: The solution will deploy a VMware vCenter instance in the secondary site management domain for the virtual infrastructure management of production and development compute workloads.
choices.C: The solution will deploy a VMware vCenter instance within the primary site management domain for hosting all management virtual machines.
choices.G: The solution will deploy a separate management domain within each site for hosting local management workloads only.
choices.B: The solution will deploy a VMware vCenter instance in the secondary site management domain for the virtual infrastructure management of production compute workloads.

questions.question_text:
An architect is designing a vSphere-based private cloud solution to support the following customer requirements:
The solution should support running 5,000 concurrent production compute workloads across the primary and secondary sites.
The solution should support running 1,000 development compute workloads within the secondary site.
The solution should support up to 50 management workloads across the primary and secondary site.
The solution must ensure the isolation of virtual infrastructure management operations between management and compute workloads.
The solution must ensure that hosting of any virtual infrastructure management workloads does not impact the amount of capacity available for compute workloads.
The solution must ensure that all production compute workloads are physically isolated from development compute workloads.
The solution must ensure that the operational management of compute workloads in the secondary site is possible in the event of a disaster affecting the primary site.
A combination of which four design decisions should the architect make to support the requirements? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABDG
Selection looks correct

choices.A: The use of an NFS mount point, including the IP address of the NFS server it is hosted on
choices.B: The use of an all flash vSAN datastore
choices.C: The use of an HCI solution for a datastore
choices.D: The use of File Based Storage, including the list of permissions applied to the share
